quotes: Screened out of competition at the 2010 Cannes Film Festival
Mulligan at the 2010 Toronto International Film Festival
Mulligan auditioned for the role of Daisy in late 2010
She returned to the stage in the Atlantic Theater Company's off-Broadway play adaptation of Ingmar Bergman's Through a Glass, Darkly, from 13 May – 3 July 2011.
Mulligan co-starred in two critically acclaimed films in 2011.
Drive debuted at 2011 Cannes Film Festival and Shame debuted at 2011 Venice Film Festival
In 2013, she starred as Daisy Buchanan in Baz Luhrmann's The Great Gatsby opposite Leonardo DiCaprio, which was released in May 2013.

organizations.name: Atlantic Theater Company
quotes: She returned to the stage in the Atlantic Theater Company's off-Broadway play adaptation of Ingmar Bergman's Through a Glass, Darkly, from 13 May – 3 July 2011.

organizations.name: The New York Times
quotes: Ben Brantley, theater critic for The New York Times, wrote that Mulligan's performance was 'acting of the highest order'; he also described her as 'extraordinary' and 'one of the finest actresses of her generation.'

organizations.name: Drama Desk Award
quotes: For her performance she was nominated for the Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Actress in a Play.

organizations.name: BAFTA Award
quotes: She received her second nomination for the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role —for the film Drive which also garnered a total of 4 BAFTA award nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director.

organizations.name: BIFA
quotes: For her performance in Shame, she received critical praise as well as a nomination for the BIFA for Best Supporting Actress.

organizations.name: The Hollywood Reporter
quotes: Todd McCarthy of The Hollywood Reporter wrote of her performance, 'Exposing herself emotionally and physically as she never has before, Mulligan is terrific in this unexpected role of a deeply wounded and troubled soul.'

organizations.name: Vogue
quotes: While attending a Vogue fashion
